subject: Art & Design
title: Custom Corporate Typefaces: When Brands Design Their Own
description: A 60-second lesson on Custom Corporate Typefaces: When Brands Design Their Own.

hook.text: Netflix spent years designing 'Netflix Sans.' Not for beauty â€” to save millions in licensing fees.

buildup.text: Major brands commission custom typefaces: Apple (San Francisco), Samsung (SamsungOne), Airbnb (Cereal).

discovery.text: A custom font ensures no competitor shares your visual voice. It's as unique as a fingerprint.

twist.text: The ROI is real: licensing Helvetica across a global company costs millions yearly. Custom fonts pay for themselves.

climax.text: These typefaces are designed for specific needs: readability on tiny screens, consistency across 100 languages.

punchline.text: When your company is big enough, even the font becomes branded.

quiz.question: Why do major brands commission custom typefaces?
options: To save licensing fees and create a unique visual identity
Because existing fonts don't work on their devices
